headline: Tanzania and Botswana offer fundamentally different experiences
summary: Tanzania provides accessible, diverse ecosystems with the Great Migration. Botswana offers exclusive, low-density experiences at 2-3x the cost. Tanzania suits first-timers and those wanting variety. Botswana suits repeat visitors seeking exclusivity and water-based activities. The choice depends on budget, experience level, and priority between diversity and exclusivity.

assumptions.text: Botswana costs 2-3x more than Tanzania for equivalent quality experiences.
Tanzania offers more ecosystem diversity: Serengeti, Ngorongoro, coastal, southern parks.
Botswana's Okavango Delta offers unique water-based safari activities unavailable elsewhere.

gains: Tanzania: Migration and Ngorongoro Crater uniqueness
Botswana: Exceptional exclusivity and low vehicle density
Botswana: Mokoro, boat safaris, and water experiences
losses: Tanzania: Higher vehicle density in popular areas
Botswana: Very high costs limit trip length
Botswana: No migration or crater equivalent

change_conditions: If budget is limited, Tanzania provides better value per day.
If seeking water-based activities, Botswana is the clear choice.
If this is a first safari, Tanzania's diversity may be more appropriate.
If seeking exclusivity above all, Botswana delivers consistently.
